author: Peerzada Ashiq
text:
Kashmiri demonstrators clash with the police during a protest in Srinagar on Thursday to markthe anniversary of the 1990 Gawkadal massacre.— PHOTO: NISSAR AHMAD

Normal life was affected in the Kashmir Valley on Thursday, with capital Srinagar and parts of south Kashmir observing a partial shutdown, to commemorate the 26th anniversary of the 1990 Gawkadal massacre, in which 52 civilians were allegedly killed in firing by security forces. However, the traffic plied normally.

Separatist JKLF chief Yasin Malik led a march towards Gawkadal. Clashes broke out between his supporters and the police.

In south Kashmir, Anantnag and Pulwama districts observed a shutdown against the killing of a militant in an encounter and a civilian in protests on Wednesday.
title: Partial shutdown in Kashmir
